result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

22CF69, 22CF94, 22CF59 called 
Attorney Richards is heard, they're not ready to proceed. Waiting on treatment court in Lacrosse to accept him. 
State is heard and not opposed.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:16 AM Cases 22CF59 22CF69 & 22CF94 called together- appearances stated. 
Defendant Limkin E.M.N. Kinani appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Limkin E.M.N. Kinani.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of these cases - probably going to be resolved, requests Aug. status date

questions by defendant - requests to pick up notice of hearing rather than having them mailed, inquires when no contact order will be lifted
Court advises clerk will hold notices for him to pick up and  def. to speak to his attorney if he wishes to have bond modified. 

Court declines to modify bond at this time
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:31 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Limkin E.M.N. Kinani appeared by video.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video audio for Limkin E.M.N. Kinani.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

22CF94 - Court reviews waiver of preliminary hearing and questionnaire form with defendant. Defendant states understanding. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and finds that the defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives right to preliminary hearing. 

22CF94 - Information was filed and brought over. 

22CF59 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count. 
22CF69 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
22CF94 - Atty Erickson is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.

Defendant Limkin E.M.N. Kinani in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Limkin E.M.N. Kinani.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 6/15/22 response to same

1:29 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Limkin E-M-N Kinani appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with LM. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $700.00 cash bond. Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is to submit to random PBT at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with LM.

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
